column2: NEVADA DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: NV

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column6: increase
column8: maintain

column2: 2. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 3. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Maintain the correct speed.

column2: 4. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column8: It improves the steering ability.

column2: 5. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 6. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 7. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column6: They don’t have rearview mirrors.
column8: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 8. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column6: be ready to stop.
column8: look for a train.

column2: 9. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 10. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 11. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 12. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 13. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: turn off the ignition.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 14. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: indicate no pass zones.

column2: 15. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: white; green
column8: green; white

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column6: Flagger ahead
column8: Side Road

column2: 17. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 18. This sign indicates:
column6: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column8: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column10: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.

column2: 19. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column6: Do not panic.
column8: Call the police.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Crossroad
column8: Hospital parking ahead

column2: 21. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column10: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 22. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you cannot change lanes.
column8: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Flagger ahead
column8: Mountain trail

column2: 24. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 25. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Enter the intersection with caution.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 26. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column6: Marijuana.
column8: Tranquilizers.

column2: 27. This sign means:
column6: Traffic signals ahead
column8: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 28. Which shape is a yield sign?
column6: Diamond
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 29. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 30. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: after changing lanes.
column8: at any time.
column10: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 31. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: High emphasis warning.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: Low clearance
column8: No right turn

column2: 33. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column6: You.
column8: Both.

column2: 34. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column6: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column8: delay near it.
column10: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 35. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: signal other vehicles to stop.
column8: slow down and enter the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 36. When changing lanes, you should:
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column10: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 37. Smoking while driving:
column6: is not distracting.
column8: helps increase driver alertness.

column2: 38. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 40. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column6: avoid scanning the road ahead.
column8: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 41. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 42. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column6: improve your driving performance.
column8: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 43. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 44. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: the type of route you are on.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 45. When following a motorcycle, drivers do not need to allow as much distance as when following a car.
column6: True

column2: 46. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 47. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 48. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 49. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column6: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 50. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
